Reviews.Title: “A warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walid K
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend, I was impressed by the modern decoration. We had an early check in the room is VERY clean well kept and maintained. The concierge and housekeeping staff are exetremly helpful. Its' located in a very nice area, fancy shoppings and good eateries. Sofa Hotel would be my choice in my future trip to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “what a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSpangl
Reviews.Content: we've been to Istanbul for 4 nights and the location at Nisantasi district is just amazing. We had a great first impression when the doormen took care of our luggage just in front of the door. The rooms are really spacious and have all you desire! Next time we will definitely stay at the SOFA Hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Badly Staffed”
Reviews.Author: Cypriot_11
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel however while the location is great, the service could not be any worse. I was not told my booking was exclusive of breakfast and it did not mention on the invoice either and although the breakfast only cost 10 Euro at check in, they charged me 65 TL (almost 25 Euro) on the day for rather very poor menu...I must admit the rooms are spacious however the staff are unhelpful and unprofessional which can potentially turn the whole stay into misery. The reception did not return my calls when asked something and they turned defensive when raised a complaint. There are many other and better hotels near and I would not stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “"Fascinating"”
Reviews.Author: OCStyle
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in Nisantasi which is a fashion district area and it is very convenient and close to night life attraction, just steps from everything. My room was very spacious, with a nice balcony , and a beautiful rain shower and very comfortable bed-mattress. The a/c - heater worked perfectly. Best of all, the service was phenomenal ... from check-in to check-out. Everybody, from the concierge to the waiters at cafe Sofa could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Special kudos to the wonderful waiters on the Cafe Sofa everyday who made my breakfasts meal there extra special. The bottom line is " Everything is extremely perfect"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lisa l
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sofa hotel with my cousin for a long weekend in May. The hotel is very modern and minimalist with a spa area.. We were in one of the bedrooms overlooking the main road and did not experience any noise. The room is a nice size with a lovely bathroom full of cute toiletries.. The hotel is based in a really nice area opposite a shopping arcade, however, if you walk a few minutes away there are some lovely restaurants you can sit outside and beautiful, high end shops. We had a hamman at the hotel spa and whilst on the expensive side it was definitely worth it and an amazing experience. We did not eat the hotel preferring to sample the local restaurants and sit outside. I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “So not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Bfdcshskpr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our Chrismas and new year holiday. It was hugely disappointing from beginning to end. The breakfast prices are crazy for what's on offer. And good luck getting coffee breakfast. This staff seems to only be focused and moving quickly when it's time to close down the breakfast buffet. The biggest problem by far is the minibar staff. Though we had turned on our "do not disturb" light, the minibar staff walked right in to the room when I was fresh out of the shower. Really. And I am not the first reviewer to note this. So when, in a flood of tears, I went to the desk to deal with this (after being promised a call back from the manager that never came), they offered us free breakfast for the stay and to upgrade our room, and to ensure the "do not disturb" light worked in the new room. Interestingly, the upgrade proved to be a downgrade. We got a "tranquility suite," which amounts to a room with no external windows, where despite contacting the desk twice a day every day, they couldn't get the temperature below about 24c/75f, which was warmer than we wanted it. The only windows in the room overlooked a rather cheesy little internal atrium with a "Japanese garden" and a direct shot view of the elevator bank, so we could never really open the curtains. And, to top it off, despite a fully functional "do not disturb" light that was turned on, a minibar man knocked on the door-- I screamed "no, don't come in!" since I was dressing. He walked away only to come back 2 minutes later and unlock the door and start to come in without knocking. I raised this again with the desk (it was the day before checkout) and they promised it would be taken care of. I checked out to not even as much as an apology. Finally, even if this place were not a management disaster, where you can be assured of being walked in on, you don't want to stay here if you are planning to get around istanbul by taxi to see the sights. Traffic in nisantasi, especially up the street where the hotel is, is horrible. More than 1/2 of the time of our trip from the airport was the last kilometer to the hotel. And one afternoon when I wanted to go to the bazaar, hotel staff simply could not get me a taxi. We tried for nearly 20 minutes and finally gave up. Coming back from a program one evening, 8 taxis turned us diwn when we told them where we were going, saying the traffic is way too much. My advice: stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rushed Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingFoodie
Reviews.Content: This review is only for the Nisantasi Sanitas spa at the Sofa Hotel. If nothing else, a spa experience should be relaxing; unfortunately, our experience here didn't meet that basic standard. We pre-booked two concurrent massage appointments, but upon arrival, we found out that the staff had only recorded one. They were able to squeeze us both in, but my husband's didn't begin until 30 mins. after mine had started. Our massages were good, but the whole experience felt rushed, we were barely able to spend any time enjoying the other amenities, and small details such as offering us water/tea were overlooked. The manager present made it clear that she had other places to be. There are a lot of options for spas/massages throughout the city, so I would recommend trying a more promising venue.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: musti_SF
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel thinking that it is chic and everything will be luxurious for our New Years event. We are not impressed. It looks nice but there is some kind of a solvent/cleaning product smell when you are waiting at the reception. I would not expect that from a luxury hotel. The price is too high for the amenities. The room furniture looked beaten up. The reception might be the slowest possible in Turkey. The staff is very kind and helpful though. They were supposed to call us when the room was ready. We never received a call. The rooms are nice but the bathroom felt a little odd. The bathroom door which is a large glass got stuck. The shower setup seems really useless. The hotel is centrally located if you are into brand shopping. You will not have Istanbul experience here. It is more like Union Square in San Francisco. It was fun for the New Years because the city has a big street party and that's what we wanted to see. The street party is only a block away from the hotel. There is no Wi-fi in the room. You need to hang out in the tiny reception area along with 100 other guests to check your e-mail. I hesitate to recommend this hotel because I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, boutique comfort”
Reviews.Author: beccaboom82
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Istanbul in the off-season with a college friend; we are both in our late 20s. We planned to spend our entire visit in hotels in Sultanahmet but realized after two days there that we needed a change of scenery. So we changed our reservation for our last three nights in the city to the Sofa, and we're so glad we did. A disclaimer: we were at the Sofa during the week during the off-season, so the usually quite high prices were much more reasonable. We got a special offer via the hotel's website which gave us three nights for the price of two with free breakfast (NOTE: the hotel does not automatically offer free breakfast!). So, check out the hotel's website for reservations! We came to the Sofa after spending our first two days in Istanbul at a family-run, very homey place. We expected that the Sofa, as a more modern boutique hotel, would be less warm feeling, not quite as hospitable. But happily we were wrong! Turkish hospitality is alive and well here. The hotel itself, it goes without saying, is pretty gorgeous. Very chic decor; we almost didn't feel cool enough to be there:) Our room was fantastic, with a rain shower, super comfy beds, and there's anything one could ever want in the bathroom: slippers, bathrobes, Molton Brown bath products (Lots of snacks available in the room as well but careful, they're not free and majorly overpriced in euros). The TV thankfully has a few English channels as well---not something common in Turkey. The concierge downstairs and the attendants in the lobby are always at the ready to help make a dinner reservation, catch you a cab, or answer general questions. Breakfast was delicious---full Turkish style (it just goes on and on), with some Western touches like bacon and scrambled eggs and potatoes. The dining room of course feels like a super cool mod lounge. Location-wise, this is a hotel for a visitor who has already been to the Old City (not totally inconvenient----the tram will get you there straightaway--but it will take some time). It's a convenient 10-15 minute walk to Taksim Square and the Istikal Caddesi and there's a metro stop reasonably close by which we found useful after a long day of trekking all over Istanbul. The Nisantasi district is a great place to go shopping and a good place to find more modern cuisine (after seven days of Turkish food, though it was delicious, we wanted a bit of a change; would highly recommend the House Cafe, a few blocks from the Sofa). We liked the fact that the hotel felt like it was part of modern Istanbul. All in all, highly recommend the Sofa (for those who can afford it). A really nice place in a hip, lively district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: angel_2506
Reviews.Content: The Sofa Hotel in Istanbul is a great hotel pick! I strongly recommend it! It is centrally located, on a very lively shopping street, rooms and facilities are amazing, hotel staff and concierge services are so helpful and polite and it has a very good price for what it has to offer! So I would say that it should be your pick!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad actually”
Reviews.Author: KimiRai
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in October 2012 as part of a work 'jolly'. The hotel itself is actually very, errrr, stylish I guess. I know it sounds strange but the first thing I noticed when I arrived was the lovely smell. Its chocolaty.... Anyway, I had what I assume was a standard room and it was excellent except for two things: First, no iron in the room and when I asked for one I waited a whole day to get it. Secondly, and this really got me, was the bottle of Evian water next to your bed. DON'T DRINK IT!!! Most good hotel rooms put mineral water in the rooms these days. It was only after I'd, albeit drunkenly, opened it did I see the â‚¬7.00 price tag. :( Other than that I found the rooms beautiful, comfy, stylish and wonderful bathrooms. I didn't really eat in the hotel so cant comment on the food but the breakfast looked nice enough. The spa in the basement is gorgeous and free for guests. The bar was good... I think. Its not however very cheap but there go. As I said we were on a work trip so not the best indication. I'd definitely consider staying again if I were on my own. The area is great.

Reviews.Title: “'excellent boutique hotel'”
Reviews.Author: DÄ°DEM K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sofa last week and it was very satisfying. The hotel is in an excellent location for women like myself as it is located in the middle of luxury shopping. Rooms are comfortable, spacious and chic. Staff is very good, personal attention to the details. Spa is great and they are running a good promotion for the hotel guests. I travel from Cyprus every month and this is the place I'm gonna be next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I was in Turkey and Greece for the last 2 weeks on business and stayed at the Sofa 3 times a total of 9 nights. We got to know the staff and found them very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were all very clean and comfortable. One suggestion I had for them is to provide complementary bottled water to guests. Breakfast is over priced, but Starbucks in right across the street in Citys Mall as well as around the corner. There are lots of shops and great restaurants in this area of town. The only negative is the traffic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TEDF81
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The hotel in very central and close to many shops which is a positive. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was excellent, with a wetroom which included a large shower and bath. The room was very well cleaned on a daily basis and nice chocolates were left which was a very nice touch. The hotel spa was very nice, included a medium size pool, jacuzzi, steamroom and sauna. Room service was nice, and when anything needed to be ironed, a member of staff collected it and returned it nicely ironed. Overall was a good experience and I would stay there again. Tip : Be careful when catching a taxi, as on 2 occasions the driver tried to pretend I gave the wrong money note and asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities, otherwise consider staying elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: AGGIE_DFW
Reviews.Content: A) The good: - Great location. Nice area. Walking distance from shops, restaurants, drug stores, bakeries, coffee shops and the like, plus shopping mall with supermarket across the street. - New property, cleanliness, spacious rooms, clean & comfy beds, nice dÃ©cor. - Attitude of concierge staff. B) The not-so-great: - Inconsistent amenities. You will have soap to wash your hands with some days, and then not. - Inefficient service: Staff during breakfast service disregards presence of guests 80% of the time. We had to stand up and go interrupt their social gathering a couple of days so that they'd bring us something to drink. Manager will pretend he doesn't see you when you signal him to please come over as you need to order something. - Key cards to rooms worked just 1 day out of our entire stay there. The rest of the time we had to always call the front desk on the housephone in hallway and have someone come open our room door. - Logistics were not thought out well: concierge is on one floor and front desk is on another. So whenever you need one thing from concierge staff and inmediately need something else from front desk staff and vice versa, you will be asked to go to other floor. - Most importantly: Front desk staff tried to rip us off at check out: Tried to sneak in a charge for an extra night. Also tried to charge us for a roller bed for our entire stay, when we only used extra bed half the time, and it was removed from room accordingly when no longer needed, which both housekeeping and front desk were aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and they try to rip you off!”
Reviews.Author: lasegy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofa Hotel for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is very nice the area surrounding hotel has nice shopping and cute cafes and restaurants, however if you are in Istanbul to mainly so sightseeing as opposed to shopping the location of the hotel is not great since it can take you up to an hour to get to the older part of the city...depending on how much of a trip your taxi driver takes you on. I was not impressed with the rooms they were outdated and some of the rooms facing the street have a huge electronic billboard right in front of the room. The T.V. is tiny. Also, I was not impressed with the cleanliness of the room and on the first day when i showered and used the toiletries, loofah, and q-tips, they were not replaced or re-filled until I left. The breakfast was bland and the selection limited. We were in town for a wedding and booked a van to take us to the wedding at 7pm when we called 10 minutes before to confirm that it would be there at 7 the concierge told us he thought we wanted it at 9!? We ended up having to take a cab. The spa is not worth it. The cherry on top was when I checked out they tried to charge me for a massage that I had paid for in cash. I insisted they show me the signed invoice stating I signed it on the room...three times/! it never came and then they admitted they made a "mistake". As I was trying to sort out the 'mistake' two other people checked out and both times there were 'mistakes' on their bill. The chocolates left on the bed at night were yummy though. Loved Istanbul and will be definitely going back but will not be staying at The Sofa Hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The Sofa”
Reviews.Author: disegnatore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sofa during Istanbul Biennal in September. The location of the hotel is very good, chic and elegant shops are just around the corner. The staff is really good and friendly, work with 'can do' attitude. Rooms are very large especially for a down town hotel, elegantly furnished, environmental friendly, they offer organic snacks in the rooms which is nice. Restaurant was just re-opened after a full renovation and breakfast was very reach. I did not use the Spa however I asked an in-room massage which was very good. I will definitely come back to this hotel as it worths the money.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful THIEVES operate in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nat_ZZZZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our Honeymoon in August and it is rather unfortunate to say that we had valuable jewellery STOLEN FROM OUR ROOM during our stay. This jewellery was a wedding gift. We have travelled to many different places and have stayed in many different hotels and so far have never had such a terrible experience. When we reported the problem to management, their reaction (or should we say non-reaction) was incredibly disappointing and distressing. Following a 6 hour wait at the police station and subsequent investigation, we found out that EIGHT different people had accessed our room during our short stay. It also became apparent from the frantic phone calls that were made by the hotel security during the police investigation that most of these people were unknown staff members that had used the master-key. This is the type of thing that we would expect from a backpackers hostel, not from a luxury hotel. Management's reaction has been absolutely appalling. We are yet to receive an apology or a "sorry for the inconvenience" from hotel management. I strongly advise that you reconsider staying in this hotel - your money and your possessions deserve better. I will say though that Ercan, the bell boy who helped us translate our ordeal to the police and waited with us until 2am (the only person who helped us from the Sofa hotel), far exceeded our expectations and is by far the best thing that the Sofa hotel has to offer - THANK YOU Ercan for all of your help.

Reviews.Title: “Especially Ms Kerimol...”
Reviews.Author: blekk
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here to the full potential! Every one in the hotel was friendly, kind, ( (Especially Zeynep Kerimol) great sence of humour, I will be there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in May with two friends. The hotel is gorgeous and in a great location. Good food and shopping within walking distance. The service was fantastic as was the hotel Spa, which we went to a couple of times. The room we got was at the front of the hotel so was a little noisy as you can hear traffic outside. However, this didn't bother us as by the time we got back to the hotel each day we were ready to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ES111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofa Hotel recently and had a great time! The location is perfect for both sightseeing as well as located in a great neighborhood for restaurants and shopping. The hotel is very new with a lovely spa, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms at the Sofa were large and well stocked with high quality toiletries. The Sofa Hotel is a wonderful choice for both the first time visitor to Istanbul as well as repeat visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin the Sofa”
Reviews.Author: Newstravels
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two boys to Istanbul for our first visit to Turkey and we stayed at the Sofa twice during our 10 day trip in Turkey. The location of the hotel is hard to fault if you like to be in one of the funkier parts of a city and we noted the location of the other 5 star options but liked this better. We found the rooms to be modern and clean with very comfortable beds and efficient friendly service from the staff. Happy to recommend it and happy to stay there again. I would have liked connecting rooms for my kids or at least have then next door but then again I am not sure we specified that when we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Was not the best choice for our first visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JBSSMS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend who had been there 5 years earlier. She was travelling with a museum group and had her days and transportation planned so it worked out well for her. We found the young men at the concierge desk to be gracious and helpful, but cannot say the same for the rest of the staff. The rooms are in need of some updating, but the biggest deficit for us was the location. We spent most of our time in the Old City, and what should have been a 15 min. taxi ride at best inevitably turned into a 40+ min. ride regardless of the time of day. The taxi drivers either don't know their way around the city or choose to take advantage of visitors at every opportunity. It was too difficult to walk to most tourist sites, so we found the location to be a huge frustration. The hotel is a small boutique hotel in a residential area with high end shopping and would be a good choice for visitors who want to shop. We would not recommend it for those who want to visit the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blackbird2011
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times and always it has been a pleasant experience. Rooms are quite spacious and high quality. Only minus is that if your room faces street side it will be noisy in night time because of heavy traffic passing the hotel. Breakfast is good and personnel friendly. Spa is relatively large and attractive. Location is excellent as the hotel is in the center of Nisantasi area, faconnable district of Istanbul. Next to the hotel you can find lots of cafes, restaurants and fashion boutiques. Looking forward to staying here soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: MoxBxl
Reviews.Content: The room and the bathroom were huge and very comfortable. The service was very friendly and professional, and the spa was quite large and cosy at the same time. The window of my room went onto the interior courtyard, which not everyone may like - but for me it was fine, and better than watching Istanbul traffic and January rain in any case!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique with all the luxuries”
Reviews.Author: RKNtravels
Reviews.Content: Sometimes boutique simply means small. This hotel delivered with large rooms, high quality fixtures and little touches such as hand made soap on a string! The bar was uber cool if you wanted to stay in. It doesn't have a pool or a view of the bosphorus but for a weekend with friends who needs that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I Have Ever Experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nahas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofa Hotel while attending a training. I will return for a vacation. The hotel is comfortable, the location is excellent, but...the service is the BEST I have ever encountered. The staff are exceptional, they are so accomodating and genuinely concerned about their guests comfort. I don't now if the managment does an exceptional job hiring, or training their staff, but whatever their secret is, they should share it! The toiletries are great, expecially the body scrub, it was amazing, they should sell it in a gift shop!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: andi035
Reviews.Content: If the ability to sleep is a criteria for your hotel selection, avoid this property at all cost. The walls are paper thin, many rooms have connecting doors allowing for an even better opportunity to be involved with your neighbors routines. Located on a busy street rooms facing the front of the hotel are subjected to constant traffic noise that does not change much during the night. Best of all however is the open air rooftop event location the hotel operates for weddings and other functions. One night of our stay a wedding party went on until well after 1.30am with hammering bass sounds that made sleeping entirely impossible until the night manager found a windowless room for us somewhere on a lower floor. Without doubt the rooftop venue is a significant revenue generator for the hotel so on balance they probably do not care about an occasional complaint. In my mind it is entirely ruthless to hold such events while having guests on the top floors of the hotel. Only after rather robust discussions was a 50% discount for the night in question agreed by the front desk at check out. Furnishings are also beginning to show wear and tear and the breakfast buffet is mediocre at best, considering the 26 Euro charge.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AkkeandLi
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were on a congress, june 1 - 5, and had a great experience with this hotel. We specially apreciated the breakfast, the helpful staff, the concierge - Deniz and his colleagues, the spa, the laundry service and the excellent bathrooms. We dont agree and we dont understand the critizism towards the crew in this forum. At all. Our room was at the garden (not the nicest view, but on this location we didnt really mind. For those who want a scenic view, do your research and pick another hotel, there are plenty.. For shoppers, this is Mecca. For the hotel: Please improve your airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: elninio76
Reviews.Content: The staff weren't flexible to switch me to street view room on high floors. The hotel is so noisy but the rooms were ok. I didn't like the staff treatment and attitued and the room view was internal to a backyard and it was terrible, I didn't open the window at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but terrible service: never again at that price”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed four nights at the Sofa hotel recently and I have to say that I am rather disappointed about that hotel. The room was ok (deluxe room) and quite spacious though noisy. The window has to be fixed by the staff since the noise is quite awful on the street. The location is very nice in the Nishantasi area, surrounded by stores though you have absolutely no view. (for that, the Ritz Carlton or the Intercontinental are the places to go to) The breakfast was ok though nothing superb The service was just rude, not polite, not even caring about our requests and what they call "the concierge" is actually the doorman. I've asked him where to find a library in the area and he asked me to type bookstore in google... Just unbelievable. We ended up spending our time at the Park Hyatt that is very near. The service was just superb, even outstanding. The concierge is absolutely lovely and took great care of us though we were not guests of the hotel. We will definitely at the Park Hyatt next time.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nms80
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the worst service ever! We had booked the 2 bedroom suite and went out for dinner after check-in. To our surprise all our luggage was moved to a tiny room on another floor without as much as a call to let us know that our belongings are being moved! Horrible smelly room with no windows and airconditioning not working. Asked repeatedly to be moved or have the airconditioing fixed but nothing happened. We had to replace our room keys EVERYDAY as theyd stop working. some days we ended up having to go to reception to ask for new keys TWICE !!!!! Dirty cutlery and tea cup wasnt removed from room for days and bathroom tissue wasnt replaced when empty till after i complained. WORST conceirge i have ever seen. He knew nothing about the area and about restaurants. Asked where Hermes was and he told me he will research and let me know. After his research he told me its in the city mall opposite the hotel. WRONG !!!! it was near chanel on a different street all together! He didnt know where Ortakoy was. Need to send their people for some serious training! However i must admit the rooms were nice especially the suites were spacious. Stayed in the Four seasons istanbul last time and was a world of difference when it came to service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst receptionists/ service ever. We checked in on Tuesday 12/4/2011 mid-day and at 12am a party started. It was really loud and the noise was felt in the room. We called the receptionist and asked politely if we could transfer as we couldnt sleep with the loud music. The receptionist said that they had no rooms available and that its a special party only for tonight and that the music will end in 30 minutes. 2 hours later the party was finally over and we could sleep after a very long tedious day. The receptionist has promised that it was only for this night and said that we can transfer only for the night to another room and return to our regular rooms the next day. On Wednesday, there wasÂ a party again even thought we were told that there will not be loud music in that day. We went to the receptionist who talked with an attitude and said that he can change our room till the next day only because "there will not be a party tomorrow". That I do not beleive because its not yet the weekend and the hotel had 2 loud parties. The receptionist told us on both nigths that there were no other rooms available and our only choice was to sleep in a suite temporarily for 1 night, or pay the extra fee for the upgrade if we wanted it for the whole period. After long talks we finally changed our room to another quite one. Its really sad that such a nice and well maintained hotel has terrible service and management. Whats worse is that a such a small request by unsatiafied Â customers to change rooms was faced with hesitance and stubborness. How hard is that request?Â

Reviews.Title: “Inspiring”
Reviews.Author: elsouille
Reviews.Content: You're inspired to work, the beds are comfortable, concierge services are great and the breakfast amazing. I will rdefinitly return to the Sofa Hotel

Reviews.Title: “well designed bad technologie”
Reviews.Author: esart71
Reviews.Content: its horrible that you will find your self in a closed room with no windows and non special ventilation type , no fresh air , the air inside the room is old as much as they open i asked the reception to change this room with no answer or even a try to help , its like this if you want stay , if you dont you can go i think its not accepatble to open a luxury hotel and well designed without good ventilation system when you find your self in a tomb and not in a hotel ,,,,,,,, it was a bad experience for me with this type of closed hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very hip hotel, style in abundance”
Reviews.Author: mirandap
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 nights in the Sofa Hotel, in a Deluxe room. Positives: - fabulous hotel, funky, hip, stylish - really huge rooms - fantsastic bathroom, loved the rain shower, and great bath, excellent L'Occitane products - lovely spa area - great breakfast - was included in our room cost - really professional staff, very helpful - lovely area, great shops on the doorstep - nice local restaurants - highly recommend the House Cafe just down the road. Negatives: - hotel not close to public transport, have to change several times to get into old town - rooms on outside of building get a lot of road noise, right through the night - flashing neon signs outside,although heavy curtains do help One word of warning for travellers to Istanbul - watch the taxi drivers!! There are common scams such as pretending the customer gave a 5TLR note when they gave a 50. Insist they drop you at the hotel door, so they are on camera, and also take note of the taxi number which is in large letters on the outside of the door of each taxi starting with the number 34.

Reviews.Title: “la force tranquille”
Reviews.Author: Fanoula41
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, staff really helpful, rooms are big, well furnished and confortable, services in the room are served really quickly with a smiling staff. The hotel is really clean and the PLUS in cold period is the access to the sauna and hamam. the Place is calm and you can relax after a long journey of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: wg284
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 night on business in Jan 2011. The expereince was excellent from the early checkin to the large room. In a great location for shopping - not that I had time, but the well heeled would enjoy it. The "supermarket" restaurant was amazing to look at even if the food was only good. The hotel even smelt beautiful. Everything was a little pricey, but there are local shops etc if you are on a budget. Worth a visit if your budget won't stretch to the "W"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: johnbrizzuto
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 8 days at this lovely hotel. The hotel was modern and immaculate. The staff was amazing and very helpful with any questions or suggestions about Istanbul in general. Big plus for English speakers like myself, the entire staff spoke English. My room was big, modern, and very clean. Awesome bathroom and shower area. The food was also A+. I would recommend trying the risotto and definitely get the daily breakfast option. Well worth the 16 euro daily fee as their is lots to choose from each morning and it was very tasty. Coming from NYC, the way I would describe the area surrounding the hotel is equivalent to being on 6th avenue in New York City without the NYC prices. Plenty of shopping, restaurants, and cafes all over the place. Even a nice art gallery across the street from the hotel in the City Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip & luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MGD54
Reviews.Content: Fabulous and very spacious deluxe rooms, dreamy bathrooms, efficient and eager staff & concierges. Excellent food as well. In the heart of an upscale shopping area, with some of the finer non-tourist restaurants, yet not far from Taksim Square (take the small shuttle bus around the corner). From seasoned, 55+ knowledgeable travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just too far from the main tourist sights”
Reviews.Author: AJ_tourist
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice stay at this funky hotel - good size comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The only downside was the amount of time it took to get to the main tourist sights and good nightlife area by public transport - if you are in Istanbul as a tourist and for a short time then i wouldn't recommend staying here just because of the location, otherwise it was a great boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, very attentive to guest needs, very good location, very comfortable hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: bab0810
Reviews.Content: spent 6 days at Sofa hotel istanbul..very good handy location easily accessible to public transport and in the middle of a trendy istanbul district...lobby is very cosy and quite comfortable..staff is incredibly attentive - one sunday morning "simit" was not there for breakfast, they bent backwards to provide it the next morning and sure enough it was there, not overlooked..:-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sven_Debby
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, design but still cosy, spacious rooms, very friendly staff, situated in the hippest district of Istanbul, very good & fresh breakfast and dinner. Unfortunately the spa was closed during our stay, due to renovation works.

Reviews.Title: “U must stay at the sofa hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MahaHSJ
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the sofa hotel for four nights and we enjoyed it alot coz the staff was very helpful and friendly as well as the location of the hotel where u can everything u want around u easily! for sure i'll be satying in it next time i come to istanbul! keep it up!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel , good atention”
Reviews.Author: daniflint
Reviews.Content: wide room, excelent breakfast, good location , value for money: avery good option

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel in great part of town- great room and very helpful service”
Reviews.Author: jean_juniper
Reviews.Content: Stayed when the ash came and loved it !!- great room with 2 extra beds for 2 children and it was large enough and the bathroom was great . Hotel staff were all very helpful- reccomended great restuarants and always willing to help us - the view from floor 8 is fab ! would have liked breakfast in the price as we ate out rather than in- but all great and I would thourougly reccomend for a non corporate stay in Istanbul . We will go back

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and location.”
Reviews.Author: dog6
Reviews.Content: it is our 5th time stay at the Sofa . we always enjoy it and would recommend it. It would be even better if the rates would be the same all through the year as on some period we got excellent rate and on other less advantageous . would be good in breafast was included in rates as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, a little too far from the sites if you are going for the wknd”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTheNorth
Reviews.Content: The room was large, the molton brown accessories were nice but this hotel disappointed on a couple of points. 1. Our room looked out on the road and there is a huge times square like billboard that was flashing all night! 2. The service was lack lustre for a boutique small hotel 3. The prices of things (coffee, food, minibar) are all in Euro and not local currency, so you feel like you are paying prices in London. 4. Gym was closed, nothing on the website about this - this why we chose the hotel, disappointing Friends stayed at Tom Tom, this seems to be the better option in this area.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: MHNZ
Reviews.Content: great hotel very clean and modern. rooms are big and comfortable. decor is luxurious and the service wasnt bad either. only hassle was location a bit far from most sights

Reviews.Title: “Trendy district, stylish rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rame30
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Sofa Hotel shortly before Easter. We had booked a Deluxe room (as we had read that the tranquility rooms do not all have a window) and were not disappointed. The room was reasonable sized, had a huge bed and a great bathroom complete with tub, rain-shower and Molten Brown bath amenities. The hotel is located in Nisantasi (a very hip and fashionable shopping district) which is north of the historic center. You will need either public transportation or taxis to get around. Also many rooms face a rather busy street. We need not mind the noise - but I am certain that it might disturb other travelers. The staff was very friendly, spoke English and German well and made good suggestions on what to see and where to have breakfast, as we had booked a room without breakfast. There are many cafes around that serve great food - try the House Cafe, Saray or the Den Cafe. We also had dinner at the hotel's restaurant Longtable - which we were told by locals is THE restaurant in Istanbul right now to have food and party. Food was good, although very expensive and hotel guest are separated from the posh turkish crowd (which is half of the experience). The spa is currently being refurbished - which is not mentioned on the website. All in all I would go there again for the nightlife (Taksim is also close by) and to do some great shopping, for sight-seeing I would rather choose a hotel that is closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yet cozy”
Reviews.Author: SoumiCPH
Reviews.Content: The Sofa is the perfect hotel when combining business with pleasure. The staff are friendly and helpful, the lounge is cozy and inviting and the rooms and especially the bathroom are extremely well set-up. We were there for 5 nights and loved our stay (moved from Dedeman). The only challenge we had during our stay was with the ventilation system - we were on a non-smoking floor but if you stood near the air ducts, the air was heavy with smoke - seemed like the ventilation system could not handle the mix and air from the smoker rooms was getting into the non-smoking floor. Do note that the hotel is on a busy one-way road so if you want to take a taxi in a rush, FORGET ABOUT IT! Also, the gym / spa is undergoing renovation which they forget to mention when we made the reservations - slightly disappointing but would still go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TimBloedow
Reviews.Content: We didn't use any of the amenities at the hotel, but all the basic services were excellent. Staff were very friendly, courteous and prompt with assistance. The room was very comfortable with a luxurious feel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, brilliant rooms and facilities. Staff more than helpful. Only down side was gym small but there didn't appear to be any other people looking to us eit so I may just be nit picking. Breakfast not great but that was down to us not them as it was a very European menu. The bedrooms are stunning as are all the restaurant areas. I would definitely recommend this hotel - funky but quality - no gimmicks!

Reviews.Title: “fashion hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chinchi50
Reviews.Content: design, very good spa, good place for clubbing and nice mojito's !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istambul with outstanding staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: AMLFP
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Istambul with outstanding staff and service! Rooms are "just okay", but the bathroom is great (the shower, the light, the sopas etc, everything is great). The staff couldnÂ´t be more helpful, polite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sofa is beautiful place to be, luxury, friendly, high desight and sophisticated.”
Reviews.Author: Opalis
Reviews.Content: It is very good hotel. High design and sophisticated. If you are looking for luxury and good value for money sofa is perfect. It is very comfortable doing meeting in lobby. very nice restoran, quite, beautiful library. Perfect location in the center in the city. Nice staff and hospitality and friendly autmosfer.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofa”
Reviews.Author: Panna
Reviews.Content: The Sofa is a lovely welcoming hotel, although our room did not have natural day light (as mentioned in other reviews) it was super large, bright and wonderfully, clean and modern, with fab toiletries, free internet. An enormous amount of thought has gone into every detail at this hotel; from the Longtable restaurant to the spa area nothing has been missed. The location couldnâ€™t have been better there are plenty of good restaurants (for example excellent Chinese Quik China) and trendy shops in every direction, and even a small shopping mall across the road (try - itâ€™s a joke â€“ quirky bar/restaurant). The Sofa concierges were excellent to. We walked to Taskim a couple of times it takes about 15 minutes (check out 360 bar/restaurant); we visited the main tourist sites and grand bazaar (preferred the souks in Marrakesh though) by taxi and took the Bosphorus ferry to check out the Asian side. We are glad we choose to stay in Nisantasi district as it is uber cool and brilliant if you like people watching and fashion. We would definitely recommend The Sofa Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a perfect stay at the Sofa. We found a sucessful mix of luxury and comfort. Service & breakfast were excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Hugie06
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Sofa Hotel. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to be in a hip neighborhood while close enough to the major city sighseeing hotspots. We experienced a really excellent service from the reception and the concierge and our room was extremelly clean. The lounge is a really warmy and hip place, nice musical ambiance and great spot for breakfast (which by the way was so good!!). The Sofa Hotel and its entire team without exception was a great part of the success of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended (and send my regards)”
Reviews.Author: Gidi_Farkash
Reviews.Content: One of the best boutique hotels I have ever seen. Recommended and send the guys there my regards from Israel.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: ArchID
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel with outstanding service and staff that add to the experience. The hotel pushes the boundaries of good design and the interiors and cocktails of the 'Longtable' restaurant should not be missed. A wonderful selection of amenities and spa products to be found in the room. The showers are awesome like a personalised spa experience. Thanks to the concierge for the pre launch tickets to Contemporary Istanbul '09. These were a great surprise and we enjoyed the show. Small touches like that added to the experience of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “warm, genuine, gracious hopitality.”
Reviews.Author: iannewyork
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights with two small children and were absolutely delighted by the hotel; the hotel is elegant and tasteful and the rooms large, well designed and comfortable. most of all, we enjoyed the service; we were met from the moment we arrived until the last minute of our departure with a genuine and remarkable warmth and attention, especially for our two young daughters; service was excellent without being stuffy or pretentious, and we found the location to be a lovely respite from the hustle and bustle of istanbul (and the more touristy areas of sultanahment)...we could walk easily to taksim square and took $10 cab rides from the hotel to see the main sites. we got an excellent rate on expedia, which delivered value as well. highly recommended. left our hearts warm.

Reviews.Title: “Deifinatley worth a stay - good fun and great pool!”
Reviews.Author: JackTSherborne
Reviews.Content: Just returned and we have had a good stay at the Sofa - generally fine although service was a tad 3rd world - a lot of flunkies to change a lightbulb but they all mean well! Would advise that the tranquility rooms are much quieter but very little natural light. The restaurant that runs directly off the reception on the first floor, the Long Table, is a must even if just for a ( very expensive ) drink. Think of fully styled up Eurotrash in their most glam outfits ( ladies with minimum of 6" heals ) and you get the vibe - fantastic for people watching!! Breakfast is not included and quite pricey - the House Cafe a 100 yards to the right of the hotel was charming and food very good for breakfast. The interior design is of a good quality and the lift fairly unique. All in all not bad value and located in an intersteting area away from the tourist bedlam. Finally the pool area is great - a really chilled oasis away from the madness of the streets. Johnny & Anna October 2009

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, concierge does it all”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamTravelmate
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located in nisantasi, nice area with lots af vibe. the restaurant is nice and the service is goo. in particular ibrahim, the concierge, was a great help

Reviews.Title: “Turkish surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mezze
Reviews.Content: I was most impressed by the location, the architecture and the service of Sofa Hotel in Istanbul. But most importantly the kind and valuable help of Egzi in almost everything (hotel, program etc.) was outstanding. Thank you for it.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, friendly, great facilities, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: francyneb
Reviews.Content: The Sofa hotel was lovely. Very good design, big room, very clean, good style, knowledgeable and attentive staff, 24/7 service, lovely view from roof terrace and great shopping nearby, particularly next door. The only drawbacks were our room had a fake window, ask for a room with a real one, and the location is not central so cabs were the best means of travel. Unfortunately, we were ripped off twice by cabdrivers (most likely due to the upscale neighborhood and being tourists). Those experiences, however, did not mar our trip, Istanbul is a wonderful city and it was nice to have a quiet place to sleep at the end of a fun-filled active day.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ZH81
Reviews.Content: Situated in one of the best areas of Istanbul, I felt at home at the Sofa hotel. The hotel was exquisite and the service was excellent. The staff were exceptionally friendly and spared no effort to make us feel welcome and at home. The rooms are stylish yet comfortable. The hotel is elegant. Attention to detail and cleanliness were most important to me and the hotel lived up to my expectations. I would not think twice before visisting this hotel again. Thank you to the staff and management for a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: annabelondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofa hotel in August for 4 nights. I've been to Istanbul before and wanted a more personal stay this time. Sofa hotel is exactly that. Smaller, intimate and beautifully designed. On the arrival we were offered cold towels and refreshing drinks. We were upgraded to a suite and offered free breakfast. The lobby is specious and comfortable. Free WiFi in the lobby is great for checking quick emails on Iphone. The service was very attentive and personal. On my first breakfast i was asked by the host if the dinner last night was good and if we are enjoying our stay. She knew my name and remembered what we were doing the night before. (You just dont get this from larger corporate style hotels). On weekend they serve breakfast on their roof terrace, which has amazing views over the city. (I don't know why they dont do it every day and also why they dont use the roof as a bar in the evening? Would make stunning evening venue.. Oh well, there are some many great places within a 5 minute walk so not really a problem). All of staff were very helpful and attentive (need boarding pass printed - not a problem, move our bags to storage when we are away - not a problem, dinner and club reservations at the hottest places on a few hours notice - not a problem .. the list goes on). The rooms are specious and beds are very comfy. The only thing i was missing in my room is Ipod docking station (you sort of expect this in boutique hotels nowadays). The only thing i would mentioned is that hotel restaurant (which is quite famous) was close for renovation and no-one mentioned it before or when we checked in. So outside of lobby bar / cafe there were no other areas to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat. Location of the hotel is great especially for shopping and other places are withing 5-10 minute taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem in a nice part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RDS33
Reviews.Content: The staff here including the concierge desk went out of their way to accomodate our needs. This is a very nice hotel with good facilities and a lovely roof terrace. Would highly recommend it. (if i was very picky the cleaner in the room could have done a better job daily as dust under beds, tables etc ie he hooevered around just the visible bits....but this is a very small point) Great overall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: MishiB
Reviews.Content: The Sofa Hotel was absolutely excellent! The room was perfect and the service even better. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and decor style”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is making up for his luck of views with excellent interior decoration. Extremely stylish rooms, amenities, flower decorations, style is present even in the elevator lighting... Nicandasi is a great shopping area, safe to walk around at all times. Hotel definitely worths a visit. Congratulations to the architectural and interior decorating team.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous. Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: catsfizog
Reviews.Content: FABULOUS!! This hotel was gorgeous. It looks great, very hip and stylish but not annoyingly so (not where you feel underdressed going to the reception) but just so you feel like you're staying somewhere a bit luxurious. Hotel staff were lovely, I asked them a number of things and needed help a number of times and they were very good. Room was great and I LOVED the walk in shower room with a fabulous shower head and some really nice complimentary products. The one detail that blew me away was that the comp paper by the bed for phone notes had my name in fancy writing on the head of it (can't help it I'm a statinery geek) and my partner liked the free chocolates every night. It was just really pleasant to stay there. They need to get wifi in the rooms as this is a basic for most travellers now. The only other prpoblem would be that you're in the chic, new (lovely) part of Istanbul. It was really nice and felt very safe but to me it could have been anywhere and if you want the Istanbul experience you'll need to be in the Old Town. If you don't need that then I'd definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our home away from home.....”
Reviews.Author: annemarievan
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul - and will definitely not be our last! What a great city. The Sofa Hotel was a very pleasant place to stay with a delightful staff who made our stay most memorable. We had a large nicely decorated inner court room with a beautiful bathroom. The breakfast buffet consisted of very fresh and carefully selected food. We will go back to the Sofa on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: holidayCagli
Reviews.Content: Our stay was really perfect! The location of the hotel is in a wanderful street of shopping and great caffetteries. The hotel has a particular and fashion restaurant where we have had a great aperitive. The room was big with an amazing bathroom. All the staff was always ready to satisfy our requestes.

Reviews.Title: “Like living with some fancy locals”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it's really interesting to stay out of the tourist area of a tourist city, more somewhere that people really live, but also a nice neighborhood where they would live. This sort of sums up the location of the Sofa in the trendy, but non-touristy Nisantasi area of Istanbul. It is an entirely different feel from either the Taksim Square area or the Bosphorous area and I'm glad we got to stay here for that reason, in addition to the hotel being pretty cool. At some points they let their desire to become a nightclub get the better of them, at the expense of their hotel guests. They closed their "hip" hotel restaurant, Longtable, on a Saturday night to all hotel guests so they could have some dramatic function with red carpets and a bunch of nonsense. That is really ridiculous, but the place is overpriced anyway, so I guess we were better off. But still, it just goes to show where their priorities are. We had one of the somewhat maligned "tranquility" rooms that have no windows, just a fake one, with a backlit curtain instead. Personally, I didn't mind it since it made the room really dark and it was really quiet which isn't always the case in other rooms in this hotel. However, my partner thought it was sort of creepy and claustrophobic to be locked inside a box like that. It is a very well decorated box though, you can't deny that. I think I would recommend this hotel be combined with another in a more accessible part of the city to the tourist sites if that is what you are there to see. It's fun to stay in two different parts of the city if you have the time and taking taxis out to this hotel would get a little old if you had to do it for too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice attention to room details--some minor issues elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: larklaw
Reviews.Content: Great attention to room detail. Bathrooms are very nice and large with tons of counter space which is very nice. Loved the shower. We stayed 6 nights and requested a very quiet room. Our room faced the inner courtyard -although to me a courtyard is something you can step out on and this you cannot. A small child could very easily fall out of the windows facing the courtyard. We enjoyed the room after long days out in the city but I can see where many would prefer a room with better natural light. I was told there are a few rooms that actually have no window---just a cut out of a window which is backlit. This seems awfully dangerous in case of a fire but there were fire sprinklers everywhere. Spa is very nice. Enjoyed the sauna and pool. Great massages. Concierge is very friendly and will try their best to help you out with reservations,etc. The reception staff is not so friendly although the men are friendlier than the women but try and deal with concierge first. Biggest issue for us during our visit was on a Tuesday we were going to stay in and at 6:30pm got a note that there would be a party on the rooftop with very loud music until 12:30am. The music/bass was beyond loud and shook parts of the room. Insane! The music turned down at 12 but still if that happened more than once during someone's visit it could be an issue. The hotel uses the rooftop for parties/rentals so who knows how often this happens. Great attention to detail in rooms and bath. Loved the neighborhood although House Cafe is a ripoff and really slow service--we like Saray better for coffee and trad meals. This area is so much better than staying in the historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to erveryone at the Sofa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sofa1
Reviews.Content: Dear Yuksel Kukul: Buldan and I had the pleasure of staying a whole month at your lovely hotel, it is beautiful in every respect. What made the experience unforgettable is the first class service,, help, smiles and loving attention we received from everyone who worked here and made every day nicer than the one before. We are now leaving with the hope that we will soon have a chance to be your guests again. I would like to be able to thank everyone individually in this email but there are too many of them and I therefore ask you to do this on our behalf. I also want to thank your staff for the copying and faxing help during the days when I had to unexpectedly work instead of enjoy beuatiful Istanbul. Best regards, Georg and Buldan Seka San Francisco, California

Reviews.Title: “i love it”
Reviews.Author: Hamad59
Reviews.Content: i love Sofa Hotel the services are fabulous & the people who work there are so helpful especially for health emergence ,rooms are clean and room service is great,location is in the heart of what's happening. simply its worth each penny payed their

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lovelylondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Beautiful large rooms,great bathrooms, very good spa. The neighborhood was perfect - far enough from the tourist rhythms to feel you were in a real live city but only 20 mins by taxi (about 22 turkish lira) to Sulthanamet and 5 mins to the ferry port to the Asian side. The area Nisantasi had some great foodie finds and a very nice feel. I would definitely stay here again and look forward to it. ps Found a great food blog site for istanbul - cafefernando.com

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe + Expensive + more,,,”
Reviews.Author: Calypso6969
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about 4 Nights very recently in the Sofa Hotel,, Its CLEAN, the Rooms are relativly comfortable in all aspects, but the size of the room is just about the minimum size, but not small. No Wireless Internet in the rooms nor corridors, which is Astonishing for a NEW+Expensive hotel,,,, 70% of the Channels are in Turkish Language,,,,a few are in english,,, some do not work.( TV Channel Variey is poor for a boutique hotel ) Breakfast Buffet is very Cosmetic, and variey is very low, not even 3 star standard , apart from the good fresh juices and fruits, i ordered a standard omlette and had to pay an extra 15 euro's per omlette + a turkish coffe cost me an extra 7 euro's, this is on top of a pre-paid 35 euro for the break-fast,,, for that money you can have 3 meals + 5 beers in any descent pub in Istanbul. Lastly, apart from a friendly conceirge or 2, the Staff rarely smile, one morning during breakfast, I honest to GOD had 3 different waiters come by my table and ask me for my Room Number. I wasn't very happy with that !

Reviews.Title: “bad air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: premierlsg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nites at the Sofa Hotel . we were upgraded to a tranquility room.The room itself was great but it was so hot you could never appreciate the room, numerous calls were made every day to try and get some help,but no help was given.. the other couple we were traveling with had the exact same problem. Plus their room was on the third floor so they heard disco music all-nite from the club below. Sorry Sofa would like to stay again,don't no if I can handle the heat and the lack of response,

Reviews.Title: “Modern and brand new”
Reviews.Author: o2travels
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel and very elagantly designed. The bathroom in the room was very nice and well appointed. It is a hotel definetly for the style conscious as also told by the various modern art scattered around the lobby. Overall a good compromise for a tourist that wants to both see the old city and enjoy the nightlife in Taksim and Nisantasi area. Very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: NIN-LON
Reviews.Content: I have discovered Sofa Hotel way back in September 2007 and since my trips trippled since then, Sofa is almost like my second home. Rooms are spacious, relaxing and bathroom is one of the best ones I have seen in hotels - rain shower in the morning wakes you up after great night in Longtable restaurant down in the lobby. Location of Sofa is right in Nisantasi, trendy Istanbul district with all the best shops around you and many cafes and restaurants on a walking distance. After day out in Istanbul I love to enjoy Taylife spa of the hotel and my experience is that their Hamam is one of the best ones in the city. Staff is really friendly, however sometimes they lack the speed, but the service is done to the perfection. I would greatly recommend this hotel as a business or holiday stay, if you decide to discover Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Leaving up to your slogan "a personalized experience"”
Reviews.Author: cris_alonso74
Reviews.Content: So I try the Sofa Hotel in the nicantasi area, the coolest area in Istanbul, packed with trendy bars and glamorous shops. This is one of the best places I have stayed in my life, and I can tell you I have been in many places. The place is special and unique. Great service, the guys at the reception really mean well, the room is just spectacular, great bed, silent, the space seems created to spend time there. The bathroom is just an experience on its own. Gigantic shower (you can stay there for an hour), bath products from L'Occitane, superb bath rope Then a Chaise Lounge where you can read for a while after coming back from work. And the room is equipped with a DVD player, music stereo and more They always leave a fruit basket at your arrival to the room that can serve as a snack for your stay, they leave little orange/chocolate treats every night, what else can you say Apart from the cafe area (where there is a nice book shop and very good sofa where I do work for a long time and the ice coffee is great), there is one of the trendiest bars in Istambul called Longtable HavenÂ´t have the time or budget to try the Spa yet but I am sure it is a great place Just a few small details to improve: Breakfast is nice (although at 22 Eur I usually just go down the street to the House Cafe) and the concierge is probably where they can improve (they donÂ´t seem to be on top of their game but improving). Then WIFI should be available in all rooms and for free in a hotel catering to travellers like me (at the end I spend up to 4 hours in the cafe area where WIFI is free and good but I will prefer to do this at my room specially on the after dinner work time) The room price at 140-150 Eur is a superb price for a place that can compete with any 5 star hotel around the world I do believe the Sofa leaves up to their new mission "A personalized experience" and I always look forward to be back here

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: firedove
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in terms of location, and how beautifully decorated it was. Unfortunately, the hotel really let down when it came to service. Some examples: (1) 2 of my colleagues staying in the same class of room as me requested kettles in the afternoon and were promptly given kettles. That evening, I also requested a kettle, and was told that my class of room was not entitled to a kettle. I mentioned that 2 of my colleagues had already gotten kettles, so how could it be that I couldn't be given one as well, but they never produced the kettle nor apologised for the discrepency. (2) Upon checking out, I had some issues over the final payment amount. Somehow, the finance department had not conveyed to the frontdesk that I had paid the full amount to the hotel upfront. As such, they kept insisting that I had booked the rooms through a 3rd party, and that the hotel did not know anything. Other issues include hotel staff trying to pick up members of our delegation, and inconsistent pricing policies. Anyone trying to book this hotel should go through their online service instead of emailing the hotel directly. We were charged more than 50% extra, presumably because of the personalised service, but that proved to be little more than a personalised "no" compared to an automated "no". Reservation staff did try to be helpful, but it appears the overall hotel policy is inflexible and more focused on making money than promoting repeat visits. Also, for business travellers, the hotel's internet is extremely slow, and there is no business centre, so you'll have to pass your documents in soft copy to the front desk for them to be printed, which can be a problem if you have confidential documents.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good - but let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: This is a classic example of an owner putting a lot of time and investment into the product - but forgetting to invest in training and service standards. The hotel is cool and chic and certainly has everything you would expect from a first class hotel. The bedroom is large, well designed, with a great bathroom. There is also a nice restaurant, bar/lounge and extensive spa/gym (even offering pilates equipment - so every detail is well thought out). The hotel is in a smart location in the city. A bit far away from some attractions - but good for shopping and business. The problem lies with the staff. They are pretty friendly - but many do not speak fluent enough English for the hotel to compete in the international arena. I had to repeat orders a number of times and on one evening tried to order a DVD to watch in my room - after an hour of waiting and repeated calls, I gave up and cancelled the order. The final sour taste came with an airport car service. As my flight arrived late, I preordered a car. The quote was very expensive (Euro95) - especially as I have been a number of times to Istanbul and know how much things 'really' cost. I then ordered a car back to the ariport and my return journey was 20% of the cost of the inbound car - I well and truely felt ripped off. This is a standard theme in Istanbul. The city is really upping its game to attract conferences, business travellers and tourists - however the rip off culture gets worse each time I visit and they will not succeed if this is not controlled. The Sofa could be very good - they just need to concentrate on staff training, standards and 'value for money'.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing and loved the Longtable”
Reviews.Author: HAM21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended and in an excellent location but it far exceeded my expectations and the recommendations. Sofa Hotel is a real gem tucked away in a bustling part of a city full of lots of other quality and magical gemstones. The service is very friendly and attentive, always there when you need it but never in your face. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable with simply elegant finishing. I tried to find one bad thing to say about the hotel but i'm afraid i can't find any. The real surprise of the hotel is the Longtable restaurant - you have the double pleasure of amazing food and a super ambience. You can also just have a drink at the bar and listen to some cool vibes. This has got to be one of the best restaurants in Istanbul. I can't wait to go back Istanbul if only to stay in the Sofa Hotel. Enjoy your stay fellow travellers. HMabinuori

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best!”
Reviews.Author: gadgeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Still the best! after staying in many other hotels in istanbul! i found the sofia via a friend and have never stayed in any other hotel in istanbul since! The service and the staff are fantastic and friendly. They really make you feel welcome and special, they also manage to balance being a cool and a traditional hotel. And yet still being modern and hip/ arty. The rooms are great, bars, restaurants also great! generally faultless! a happy customer! Thanks sofia! would never consider staying any where else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot for a trendy urban life in the hearth of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ZippoRoma
Reviews.Content: This time visiting Istanbul for business I decided to stay at the Sofa hotel as it is located in the very center of the Nisantasi district that is (from my perspective) the coolest area in Istanbul, packed with trendy bars and glamorous shops. The overall architecture of this hotel is really nice. Excellent interior design spiced with artistic sculptures and paintings are able to create a rich and soft environment perfect for cooling down after a frantic day in the Istanbul urban life. Rooms are also very beautiful with a functional and tasteful design. The only issue I had was an ongoing construction in front of the hotel creating some disturbing noise during the night. But this is Istanbul a city that never sleeps. and sometime not letting you sleep either ;-) Special mention to the great food in the cafe restaurant along with its perfect service. A place where I will pay for sure another visit especially if they keep offering some special discounted rates via expedia !!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but hotel a victim of its busy location.”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel after reading many of the positive reviews on this site. We have stayed at many 5 star Istanbul hotels and wanted to be in the center of the city. The rooms are very nice and the hip quotient is high. The staff is also very eager to please. The rooms were spacious and the beds quite comfortable. Those are the positives. If you are looking for a good night's sleep, you have to choose the Tranquility Rooms. Unfortunately, as I am claustrophobic, I could not go with this options as the rooms face a small shaftway looking at other interior Tranquility Rooms. They say that the view is of a Japanese Garden; however, you have to look down the shaftway to see the garden. As the room does not get much natural light, it is very dark. The rooms facing the front of the hotel face a huge electronic billboard on the facade of the shopping mall across the street. We were also unfortunate enough to deal with a commercial shoot on our first night which lasted until 4:00 a.m.. 200 extras, screaming directors and spotlights. We moved to a room in the back of the hotel. The room was smaller and I was a bit concerned as there was construction in the back. I was assured that construction was during regular hours. Unfortunately, the construction started 6:00 am. and on that night continued until 2:00 a.m. The staff was sympathetic and nice enough to upgrade us to a suite; however, the extra space did not make up for the noise again on busy Friday and Saturday nights. The hotel has a very popular nightclub , so as the evening progresses, the sound of honking horns is non-stop as the cars clog the small road. All in all, we did not get the rest we were looking for and would have changed hotels had we not prepaid through a third party vendor. I would recommend that the hotel install triple-paned windows to block out the noise and somehow try to deal with the cars blocking the road for those patrons coming into/leaving the nightclub. They should also provide earplugs in the room. If you are not a light sleeper or can cope with the Tranquility rooms, I would say that you would be okay with the hotel. Also, tbe aware that here is no wireless Internet in the rooms. The cost of ethernet service is also quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Five Days”
Reviews.Author: LPSExton_PA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five fabulous nights at the Sofa. It was everything we look for in a "high design" hotel. Room was large and well-equipped with Flat Screen TV, etc. Bathroom was as good as it gets with a separate rain shower room beside the bathtub. Definitely met our criteria for the "hip quotient". The Nistansi area- where the hotel sits on a very busy street- was a lot like the high fashion areas of Barcelona full of great shopping and trendy restaurants. Unlike Barcelona,we always felt safe no matter what time of day or night we walked around. Common area lobby was very comfortable and a great place to have breakfast (full buffet), afternoon coffee and evening drinks. Longtable- the hotel's restaurant and nightclub- was one of the highlights of our trip. All the "pretty people" of Istanbul gathered to eat, drink and party. The food was great and the scene was just amazing. Surprised by how well-priced our Saturday Soiree was considering the food and atmosphere. Without a doubt, best thing about the Sofa was the staff and their level of service. We felt more like welcomed visiting cousins of a hip-and-wealthy family than hotel guests. They went out of their way to make everything perfect- and always with a smile. Even though we had booked a "bargain" rate over the Web, we were treated like "high rollers". Questions and pleas for advice on restaurants, shopping, tours, etc were always answered with great suggestions. Everyone went out of their way to please and serve us- not because they had to, but because they wanted to. On our second night, the couple next store stayed up all night being drunk, loud and obnoxious. When we mentioned it the next morning, the staff was very upset. When we came back from shopping that day, we had already been upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. You don't see this very often in the world of high design hotels- and we have stayed in many over the last few years. We just loved Istanbul and plan to go back next year. We will certainly be staying at the Sofa- this time we will splurge for a suite- they are definitely worth the extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: “meet the neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: ho_vienna
Reviews.Content: perfect match: a hip hotel in a hip neighbourhood- and you can walk to thr metro, wich is not a given in istanbul! rooms are spacious, wellstyled, as well as the bath. currently (nov.08) you might be annoyed by a construction-site if you stay in one of the rooms overlooking the garden, but thats what it is like, when you visit a dynamic city! (and as a trade-off you can enjoy a view of the bosphorus, until the building is finished) the bar in the first floor, where also the great breakfast is served, doubles as a meetingplace for well-off locals, so you get an idea, whatÂ´s going on in the city, the restaurant is a waterhole for local society- and they seem to know about food! if you are reading orhan pamuk to get into the groove of istanbul, which i strongly recommend, look out of your window, and check if heÂ´s writing on his next oeuvre- his appartement is just two houses up in the street, and when the lights are on in the penthouse, he is in...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler13
Reviews.Content: The Sofa is a very nice hotel outside "The Old City". It is modern, clean and has fantastic amenities. The toiletries were reason enough to stay. The bed was comfy, with a selection of pillows. The room had a flat screen tv, mini bar, safe, robes, slippers, tasty chocolates, and a very cool bathroom. There was a large shower with a giant rain-type shower head, and in the same glassed in space, was a separate tub with luxurious bath salts available. There was a fantastic selection of shampoos and soaps. My room was facing the City Mall on the main street. The pros were a view of people and a small balcony. The cons were noise (which didn't really bother me because I'm from New York) and a large ever-flashing video screen that strobed all night long, even through the blackout curtains. But this room is the best choice after hearing about my co-worker's rooms. One friend had a room on the 2nd floor right over the very popular restaurant and bar. The thumping of bass all night long, caused him to change rooms in the middle of the night. Other rooms had only an interior zen garden view. No outside light, no idea if it was sunny or raining. Ask for a street view on a high floor. The staff was very accommodating-except in the breakfast room. But I found this to be a common problem in all restaurants in Istanbul. There really isn't a concept of checking on guests to see if they need anything else. More often than not, I had to carry my coffee cup to them for a refill. The buffet breakfast was not included in my case. And it was outrageously expensive. 43 YTL (which is about $32.00). And not worth it. They had a big variety of olives and cheeses, but the vat of scrambled eggs was grossly runny. So I only found about $5.00 worth of food to my liking. One day I ordered room service (for considerably less money) and asked for my eggs to be scrambled-well done. They were like a bowl of egg soup.
