I sent them back and suggested they cook them till they were brown. I got in return, slightly less runny eggs. So breakfast is a definite con. There was a lovely wellness and detox center downstairs that I didn't have a chance to use. But it looked really nice. The restaurant/bar was pretty cool. It had super fun decor, and each table was of a unique style. I recommend the kebab pizza. The specialty drink menu is only recommended if you have an unlimited expense account. The entertainment in the bar is fun. Out comes a cool looking rasta dude, who proceeds to sing every cheesy Vegas song every composed. He walks around and sits at ones table while he sings. It's a good time. Very nice management as well. This seems to be a popular spot with the locals. Very young and trendy. Remember, don't get a room above it. If I needed to be in Istanbul, and I didn't want to be in The Old City (which I can't imagine), I would stay there again. It's about a $16.00 cab ride into the Old City. Traffic is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Please to discover such a GEM”
Reviews.Author: alfavita
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to discover such a nice hotel, in the heart of Nisantasi, the nicest and very European part of Istanbul(Orhan Pamuk is speaking about). We lived in Turkey for more than 4 years so over that period we stayed in Ciragan, Swiss, Hilton and Marmara .At that time there was not such a nice one in Nisantasi so we had to get there by car as this is the part we loved for its coffeshops and it's preWW2 European arhitecture .We wanted to try something new this time(middle of August) and so we chose Sofa as we wanted to sample a boutique hotel with a good location(by our standards, we are not going for tourism but to get together with friends and feel the magic of Istanbul so we did not visit the historical part). Very happy with our choice as proved by the high standards of the service,rooms(size and quality a big plus to other chain hotels) and we got even a view on Bosphorus(from a suite on the last floor). Even by Turkish standards(very high on the service side) we had an exceptional time in Sofa. Nicely impressed by the way the lady GM is engaging with the guests and by the quality of the accomodation that make you feel at home.Many thanks to the staff for the way they spoiled us .Location is perfect as is close by car to Levent,Etiler,Ortakoy and even the amazing new mall Istynye Park. The only sad thing to mention is that what used to be the parking where we were leaving the car in the past is this upscale new Mall, just across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How All Hotels Would be in a Perfect World!”
Reviews.Author: marissaX
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It is away from the tourist area - though there are many upmarket shops and restaurants in the area to choose from. You are spoilt for choice. The area is similar to Knightsbirdge in London so tourists do not stand out & more importantly - you are not constantly hassled! There is absolutely nothing I dislike about this hotel. It is beautifully designed with great attention to detail, comfort & service. The staff are well trained, very committed and polite (very important). Everything in the the hotel from the rooms to the food & drinks are beautifully presented and the Spa is gorgeous with very professional staff!. I imagine that the owner of this hotel is very fussy and has thought through everything that he/she might want from a hotel because you certainly get it here. I am also fussy and believe me - nothing is compromised. The first time we stayed I forgot my mobile phone charger and within 5 minutes a charger had been sent to our room. The second time I forgot my adaptor plug and the same thing happened. When I wanted an English newspaper one of the front desk people (located on entry floor) simply asked for newspaper names and ran out to a local and delivered it to the room. When a taxi driver tried to 'rip me off' by charging triple price from the Grand Bazaar in Sultan Ahmet back to the hotel, the front desk man asked for his registration number, which I had. We have stayed here 3 times and quite honestly I would not really want to stay anywhere else in Istanbul. In fact the hotel was so comfortably I never really wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul by Far”
Reviews.Author: KSaral
Reviews.Content: My wife, her family and family friends stayed at Sofa Hotel for 14 days before our wedding in Istanbul. The location of this hotel, Nisantasi, is by far better than any others as it is in walking distance to some of Istanbul's best restaurants, cafes, and shopping centers. Central location also allows for easy and fast access to any other parts of the city.The rooms were spacious, modern, and very luxurious - specially the shower/bathing area was very impressive and relaxing..Hotel has an excellent breakfast open buffet, a great bar/restaurant, and probably the best Turkish bath/spa in Istanbul. We actually had guests that stayed at Swissotel and they were referred to Sofa Hotel's spa as theirs was closed for renovation! Staff is like I've never seen before; extremely helpful, kind, capable and polite. 24/7 service for "literally" anything you may need in istanbul was unbeliavable. An excellent boutique hotel; probably the best we've ever seen..Higly recommending it to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: joecool69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating an anniversary and we thought why not splurge a little and stay at this well-reviewed boutique hotel in Istanbul. We were happy with our decision. The Sofa Hotel is a fabulous hotel in the heart of the shopping district in Istanbul (Nisantasi). When we checked in, we were really impressed by the well designed lobby/bar area, and the helpful check-in staff, led by Arda. Our rooms were comfortable and clean, with a gigantic bathroom and flat-panel LCD TV. There were lots of construction noises at night, but that was not the Hotel's fault. In addition, the hotel had a beautiful Spa/Fitness area with a small relaxing pool meant for sense deprivation I think. In addition there was a traditional Turkish Bath and Sauna. The concierge team, lead by Deniz, Alican, and Murcan, really helped us out and pointed us in the right direction daily, from walking routes to detailed guides of local metro. The metro is very well organized, but talk with the concierge team because they can give you some good tips, especially about the boat routes which you'll need if you want to visit Prince's Islands. The hotel is about a 20 min walk to Taxim Square, and 20 min walk from Dolmabache Palace, so be prepared to exercise. However, we always felt energized because of the great breakfast spread. The wait staff, including Izlem and Ahmet, were friendly and attentive. A few issues was that the restaurant that the hotel recommended, Kosibasi, really took advantage of my wife and I being tourists, and ripped us off for dinner. We spoke to other tourists and they had the same thing happen to them. We were charged 10 Liras for a plate of tomatoes that we thought was on the house (and according to other friendly Turkey locals, they should have been), bread that was put on our plate that we were charged 5 Liras a piece for. Very unprofessional. Also, at checkout, we were charged incidentals that we didn't pay for. But the hotel staff resolved that quickly, though it was really surprising since my wife and I make a point to count every piece of food in the bar fridge. This could have been an honest mistake though. All in all, a great time was had. When we checked out, Deniz made sure that our taxi had a fixed rate of 40 Liras to the airport. Make sure you always ask for this, and just take care of your concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Sofa! Worth every bit”
Reviews.Author: moonrose12
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the sofa for 8 days for our 5 yr anniversary and it was simply wonderful! From the very beginning we were welcomed with Turkish sweets, chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in our room. It was chic, clean and had the most amazing bathroom with luxury toiletries. Although we didn't have the main street view we had the back street which had construction- this was not the hotel's fault and we didn't mind it. We have traveled extensively around the world and this hotel exceeded our expectations. The front desk with Arda and his team to Alican and his team at the concierge they took personal care of all our needs. The staff would always greet us and make us feel very welcomed, even the breakfast staff was fantastic. We had breakfast included in our package deal we got from Orbitz (one tip: Make sure you contact orbitz before to make sure that the hotel knows breakfast is included, we had that problem but orbitz fixed it immediately and the hotel staff was apologetic.) We walked everywhere and used the public transportation, so there was no need for a taxi at all. The area the hotel is in is hip, chic, trendy and super safe. I would recommend this area for people who don't want to be stuck in the tourist trap areas of Taksim and Sulmahanet. This is literally a 20 min walk to Taksim which is what we did every day. There are some fantastic restaurants and cafes nearby the hotel (Tip: Avoid Koshibashi rest, they overcharge when they see tourists!!). Our breakfast buffet every morning at the hotel consisted of fresh juices, pastries, breads, cheeses, olives, yogurts, eggs, bacon and hot vegetable medley! It was absolutely delicious. Also, we highly recommened chilling at their bar area for one night, it is soo relaxing and truly a hidden find. As a guest, you also have access to their Spa services which include the Turkish bath ( I used to go on my own for free, if you ask for someone to do a massage you have to pay), fitness center and relaxing pool (tip:after a long day sightseeing, go there to relax-its totally worth it!). Finally, having free wireless service in the lounge definitely was a big plus as brought our laptop (they charge you if you use it in the room so just go to the lobby). The SOFA hotel is definitely worth the trip and made our stay in Istanbul a memorable one- we highly recommend it. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Unique Sofa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: krof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofa Hotel in Istanbul and found the experience exceptional. The Sofa is an amazing architectural building. The design is modern and unique and the rooms are elegant as well. What really distinguished the Sofa was the staff. This was our first visit to Istanbul and we are not the kind of people who normally gravitate to tours. It is sometimes harder to see a city but the front desk staff and concierage were exceptional. We also wanted to travel through the Adriatic coast of Turkey and the staff really organized everything that we wanted by arranging a driver and personal guide. The trip outside Istanbul was a delight. The driver and guide were exceptional we were wisked thorugh waiting lines at sites we wanted to see. In Istanbul we inquired about available restaurants and each night dinners were suggested at different restaurants all of which were just great. And what was great was that the restaurants were not tourist haunts but local delicious restaurants in the neighbourhood around the hotel. One of us eats vegetarian which is always a little more difficult to find. We did splurge 1 night and went to the Bosphorous for a dinner and walk by the harbourfront of the Bosphorous and looked on the yachts and night life of Istanbul. It was a delight. We had some very special requests as well as the normal tourist sites. We wanted to see some of the Jewish sites of Istanbul. There had been several terrorist attacks against the Jewish community and as a result they had super strict security protecals. No problem the front desk manager was able to overcome the obstacles and arranged access to every site we wanted on relatively short notice. We are demanding guests as we have investigated a city before we come and have a whole list of things we want to see. The staff were very accommodating to our every request. There is free internet in the lounge, free newspapers, a great bar lounge and a good location to navigate Istanbul. I feel that if one is visiting Istanbul and is looking for a friendly accomodating place to stage your visit the Sofa Hotel is a sure bet for people looking for an exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “A different pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tripper4188
Reviews.Content: I have just landed to Istanbul after my long business trip around Europa and Middle East. My house is under renovation and I decided to stay in Sofa Hotel &Residence before moving to my new renovated house. I did my my reservation via web site. Hotel's web site is very clear and very informative. Very nice web site... After arriving to Istanbul, hotel made all my transportation to hotel. As soon as we entered to the place where hotel is located, I thought it is going to be so noisy, because of hotel is located in the heart of Istanbul. But after arriving to my first impression was, feeling like in my own place. Hotel was so quite and hotel stuff very well trained, polite and firendly. Check-In process finished very quick and we were in our room in 10 minutes after arriving. Hotel was very well designed. I had a chance to talk to Hotel Manager Mrs. ArÄ±kok who was one of the best intellectual person who I ever met. I talked to her about my new house and she even help to arrange a meeting with the hotel's interiror designer. Very well done. Rooms are very good designed. As I mentioned above, first I thought it was going to be noisy, but this hotel is very perfect gateway to escape from city, while ou are still in it. As I said, it was a big pleasure to spend 5 nights in this hotel, and I would like to thank you, firstly to hotel manager Mrs. ArÄ±kok then all the stuff, to be very patient and frinedly during our stay with my wife. Thank you Sofa for this very nice adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative experience”
Reviews.Author: renbrandt
Reviews.Content: We're veteran travelers, so I don't write lightly that the Hotel Sofa is among the best places we've ever stayed. But it most definitely was. In addition to the usual luxe amenities -- good spa products, in-room safe and mini bar, lavish breakfast, spacious room, high-count bedding -- it offered such thoughtful extras as a free laptop and wi-fi connection for the asking in the lobby, a walk-in rain shower, DVD library and equisite decor. We prefer boutique hotels for their individuality and high standard of service, and this one delivered. When my daughter called the front desk to say she was having trouble making the room key work in the light slot, the clerk responded, "I will be there in haste!" And he was. My mother suffered a bad fall when a taxi sped from the curb before she was safely inside, and hotel personnel took a personal interest in her injuries -- visiting the nearby police station to make a report, bringing us first-aid supplies (including old-fashioned iodine and peroxide) and calling numerous times to check on her health. In fact, two weeks after our return I received an email from the hotel manager asking how she is. Istanbul in general, and the Hotel Sofa in particular, had some of the nicest people we've met in our world travels.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful interiors, bad service”
Reviews.Author: chillaxinNewYork
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for hotels, this one stood out. It is fabulous in a very modern, edgy way. I booked the hotel through the hotel website and ordered a transfer from the airport to the hotel upon my arrival. On the day of my arrival, my plane was about one hour later than the arrival time that I quoted the hotel due to mechanical problems. Also, it took a bit of time to go through the passport and visa lines. When came out into the main terminal, I was two hours later than the 5:00 arrival that I told the hotel. The hotel said, however, that they checked the airlines for timing. The long and the short of it was that no one was there to pick me up. I traversed the airport for about 1 hour without finding anyone designated to pick me up. Noone. I took a car into the city for 120 turkish lira (probably too much). When I arrived at the hotel, I asked them to refund the transfer cost. They would not do it. I asked to speak to a manager about it, but the person at the reservation desk began to get upset with me and eventually started browbeating me into paying this amount. By the time she was done, I was in tears (no joke). She wouldn't let me speak . . . I would open my mouth to explain and she just slammed her hand down on the desk saying "we paid for it and you weren't there when you said you would be so we left -- but we were there, so you must pay." What car service arrives without checking the arrival time before hand and then just leaves? OMG! I just paid it so that i could get away from her and upstairs to my room. Another employee followed me up to my room and apologized for her colleague, but by then, I just wanted to leave the hotel. I was looking forward to staying there but having been abused about a situation that was clearly their problem, the trust was gone. I was traveling alone and wanted to feel as though the hotel had my back a little bit. Not the case. Then, because it was late and i was exhausted, I ordered dinner. Average taste for exhorbitant cost. And again, so so service. The next day, I went to the W Istanbul. They upgraded me to an amazing room (the one at the Sofa is nice, but very plain). So the long and the short is that the hotel is very attractive and well located but the staff are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gelPiraeus_Greece
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in late February 2008. The hotel is a great, great boutique hotel in the heart of the most fashionable shopping district of Istanbul, Nisantasi. The check in was a pleasant and warm experience, albeit somewhat slow. The staff was extremely friendly, attentive and polite throughout our stay. The room was great, spacious (mind you this was the regular room, not some suite), and had all the goodies one would expect from a luxury hotel. Somebody had handwritten my name in the notepad next to the bed prior to my arrival there, certainly a nice touch. The price was reasonable, I booked through an internet site, and it cost Euro 162.- including all taxes, but without breakfast. The price for evertything for sale in the hotel was quite expensive. Breakfast was Euro 24 per person, and somebody charged us that, even though we only had one cup of coffee. We picked this up when paying the bill, and it was refunded swiftly. Overall, great place to relax in Istanbul, especially if you want to avoid being near all the tourist attractions for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Oroppas
Reviews.Content: Darling little hotel with excellent service in a swanky neighborhood. Many great shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance. Stayed here for business but would recommend it for those on holidays. Great if you want a place where you can relax away from the tourist-infested areas of town with some style...

HotelInfo.Name: The Sofa Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Tesvikiye Caddesi 41-41A | Nisantasi, Istanbul 34367, Turkey
